question: The first girder of the mega project, MTHL was recently launched, which when completed will be the longest sea-bridge in India. Where is MTHL situated?
explanation:
The Chief Minister of Maharashtra, Uddhav Thackeray launched the first girder for the Mumbai Trans Harbour Link (MTHL) mega project, along with the Mumbai Metropolitan Region Development Authority officials.
The project connects Mumbai to the adjacent Raigad district and is expected to be made operational by 2022. The project entails a cost of nearly â‚¹18,000 crore and it is financed by a loan from the Japan International Cooperation Agency (JICA). The foundation stone for the project was laid by Narendra Modi in 2016.
